title: RuntimeError "sizes must be non-negative" (0.4.1)
body_html:
Issue description

this is related to issue #10424 but has an example that works on 0.4.0 and actually dimensions ARE non-negative (0 is non-negative)

Code example

torch.zeros(3,4,2,0).shape

In 0.4.0 creates an array of size [3,4,2], in 0.4.1 -- fails with message:
RuntimeError: sizes must be non-negative

System Info

Please copy and paste the output from our
environment collection script
(or fill out the checklist below manually).

You can get the script and run it with:

body:
## Issue description
this is related to issue #10424 but has an example that works on 0.4.0 and actually dimensions ARE  non-negative (0 is non-negative)


## Code example
`torch.zeros(3,4,2,0).shape`

In 0.4.0 creates an array of size [3,4,2], in 0.4.1 -- fails with message:
`RuntimeError: sizes must be non-negative`

## System Info
Please copy and paste the output from our
[environment collection script](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pytorch/pytorch/master/torch/utils/collect_env.py)
(or fill out the checklist below manually).

You can get the script and run it with:
```
PyTorch version: 0.4.1
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: None

OS: Mac OSX 10.12.6
GCC version: Could not collect
CMake version: version 3.11.2

Python version: 3.6
Is CUDA available: No
CUDA runtime version: No CUDA
GPU models and configuration: No CUDA
Nvidia driver version: No CUDA
cuDNN version: No CUDA

Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip] numpy (1.15.0)
[pip] numpydoc (0.7.0)
[pip] torch (0.4.1)
[pip] torchfile (0.1.0)
[pip] torchvision (0.2.0)
[conda] pytorch                   0.4.1           py36_cuda0.0_cudnn0.0_1    pytorch
[conda] torch                     0.4.0a0+265e1a9           <pip>
[conda] torchfile                 0.1.0                     <pip>
[conda] torchvision               0.2.1                    py36_1    pytorch
[conda] torchvision               0.2.0                     <pip>
```
